security: Revealing that BATISTA was granted a Provisional Operational Approval and an Open Operational Approval for use as a PP Agent in Havana, Cuba, could expose past operational activities and compromise individuals associated with the CIA.
summary: A memo details Laureano BATISTA's connection to the CIA as a PP agent and his alleged involvement in sending Cuban exiles to a training camp in Louisiana, as reported by Rudolph Richard DAVIS.
summary_one_paragraph: This SECRET memorandum, dated December 13, 1967, discusses Laureano BATISTA's CIA connection and his alleged role in providing Cuban exiles for a training camp in Lacombe, Louisiana. According to Rudolph Richard DAVIS's 1964 FBI statement, BATISTA sent 19 men from Miami in response to DAVIS's 1963 request, who were intended to work in a lumber business in Guatemala but became disgruntled after the FBI seized explosives nearby. The memorandum also notes that BATISTA, as Secretary of Military Affairs for Movimiento Democratica Cristiano (MDC), had received operational approval from the CIA for use as a PP agent in Havana, Cuba, and offered the MDC's services to the Hungarian Freedom Fighters.
title: BATISTA, Laureano
